description: Going down the 1 block street of Lacona, the right-hand side of the road is rife with potholes from sewer cave ins or other drainage issues. The LEFT hand side, the curbs are all deteriorating from rain runoff over the years.  Lived here 5 years and as of yet, there's never been a comprehensive repair job performed anywhere on this block.   Many calls have been placed, but no one ever comes out to patch or repave this road.  Considering the light traffic it receives for only being one block long, you'd think a repair would last a LONG time.  residents have taken to making their OWN repair work with Sakrete, just to help keep the curb deterioration from ruining their driveways.  PLEASE, come fix this road!!!
summary: Lacona Street:  Widespread disrepair and potholes

description: This hill is FULL of potholes.  Needs fixed right away.

On Mountain Avenue (off of Wagner in Mt. Oliver/Carrick area) there is a stretch of road that really is like navigating a minefield.  Cars go on the opposite side of the road multiple times to escape HUGE holes in the road. You can tell that there is water that runs off which is probably the cause for this, and that also has not been addressed. 
I believe I have sent 2 requests for the city to at least fill the holes with no response other than they received my request.  This area is a shortcut for many people and is heavily traveled, especially at rush hour.
The hill at the end of Dunster Street down to Abstract Avenue is horrible.  Holes all over the place and a lot of hubcaps to the side of the road.

Pothole in Lacona Street, right on the blind 90-degree turn from Transverse makes drivers swerve into oncoming traffic on an already narrow and congested lane.  I've personally witnessed at least 4 near-collisions as a direct result of this pothole.
summary: Dangerous pothole at blind corner / Lacona Street & Transverse

description:
Dwight Ave from "not a through street" to the end needs to be paved.  They have patched some potholes twice in the past but NEVER have fixed the street properly since we moved here 7 years ago.  They repaved all the streets around us a year or so ago, but not our portion of the street.  The street is horrible!!

As of this date (3/5/13) NOTHING has been done.  We pay taxes like everyone else but they seem to ignore at this end of the street.  It is disgraceful that they CHOOSE to ignore the problem, rather than fix it (like other streets around us have been fixed).

The section above Marshall got re-paved last summer but they only patched (again) the section between marshall and Federal. The potholes re-open every time a plow or large vehicle hits them, and they are difficult to avoid with all the cars parked on-street on this stretch!

It's time to tear up the road and re-pave, because the city's patch jobs never hold and the back streets in the area are even worse!
This whole stretch of W. North Avenue from Cedar to Brighton Rd is very rough and in need of paving badly.
address: W North Ave Pittsburgh / Allegheny, PA

description: Decent sized pothole right where left tire would go when going straight onto McAnulty Drive.  Can't see it due to steepness until it's too late.
summary: Massive pothole on a blind hill.

description: Multiple potholes on Mary st for the last 5 YEARS!!!!!
huge hole heading towards McDonalds in between Cape May and Pauline Ave. it's on the left side of the street.
address: 1900 W Liberty Ave Pittsburgh, PA 15216, USA

description: many huge potholes that were reported many times but never fixed.
summary: humongous potholes all along shank street

description: pothole right at the intersection of corliss and west carson. if you were making a left from the corliss to west carson.there are alot of potholes from corliss and w. carson all the way to stanhope st.
summary: potholes from corliss st and west carson all the way to stanhope st.
address: 2403 W Carson St Pittsburgh, PA 15204, USA

description: A really large pot hole at top of Vista near Goehring takes up almost half of road.  There are at least three other smaller potholes on Vista also.
Entire right side of Mountain Ave (turning from Wagner) is a mess. People drive on opposite side of road to avoid it.
Pioneer Avenue and Brookline Avenue are really bad with pot holes
Panther Hollow Rd make rt. from Greenfild rd go towards Blvd. of the Allies. This road FILLED with holes.  Must ride in other lane to avoid potholes.
